slidelink.displaytext: Learn how to tow a trailer safely

search.slidetext: --- start course start course start course start course start course start course trailer safety awareness program fleet services

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% download the course companion to follow along download the course companion to follow along this module is approximately 20 minutes long trailer safety awareness program table of contents towing a vehicle cargo weights & measurement breakaway brakes tow hitch tow ball trailer lights hooking the trailer electrical cables chains loading the trailer wind & turbulance maximum speeds university policies checklist
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% learn how to tow a trailer safely fleet services maintains 325 trailers
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% 20,000 people will require medical attention 400 people will die every year 2 billion/annually in accidents trailer accidents are 100% preventable

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% trailer safety awareness program goal promote safe towing practices objective raise awareness of your role & responsibilities decrease number of accidents proper trailer size hitch balancing load breakaway brakes inspecting the equipment
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% prevent trailer accidents by asking yourself a series of questions
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% always select the proper towing vehicle
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% check the cargo capacity sticker on the trailer

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect the correct answer is on the tow tongue. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue test your knowledge where, most likely, can you find the sticker that displays the trailer capacity? on the tow ball on the tow ball on the tow ball on the tow ball on the tow ball on the tow ball inside the car inside the car inside the car inside the car inside the car inside the car on the tow tongue on the tow tongue on the tow tongue on the tow tongue on the tow tongue on the tow tongue on the car manual on the car manual on the car manual on the car manual on the car manual on the car manual click the submit button
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% become familiar with measurement acronyms
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% gross trailer weight rating gtwr gross trailer weight rating classes of trailer hitches
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% gcwr make sure not to exceed the combined weight gross combined weight rating check the manufacturers guide for the gcwr

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect the correct answer is the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue test your knowledge what does the gross trailer weight rating (gtwr) define? how fast you can drive the towing vehicle how fast you can drive the towing vehicle how fast you can drive the towing vehicle how fast you can drive the towing vehicle how fast you can drive the towing vehicle how fast you can drive the towing vehicle the weight of your car the weight of your car the weight of your car the weight of your car the weight of your car the weight of your car the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow the total weight the vehicle is rated to tow the length of the trailer the length of the trailer the length of the trailer the length of the trailer the length of the trailer the length of the trailer click the submit button
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect the correct answer is towing vehicle, towing package and trailer. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue test your knowledge what are the 3 components needed to tow a trailer? towing vehicle, towing package and trailer towing vehicle, towing package and trailer towing vehicle, towing package and trailer towing vehicle, towing package and trailer towing vehicle, towing package and trailer towing vehicle, towing package and trailer ball, hitch and tongue ball, hitch and tongue ball, hitch and tongue ball, hitch and tongue ball, hitch and tongue ball, hitch and tongue electric cables, brake cables and chains electric cables, brake cables and chains electric cables, brake cables and chains electric cables, brake cables and chains electric cables, brake cables and chains electric cables, brake cables and chains suspension, brakes and transmission suspension, brakes and transmission suspension, brakes and transmission suspension, brakes and transmission suspension, brakes and transmission suspension, brakes and transmission click the submit button
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% the toll hitch attaches directly to the chassis of the towing vehicle gtwr refers to the durability & strength of the bars
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% check the size of the ball to make sure it is compatible
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% types of tow hitches
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% trailer lights

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% before hooking up your trailer perform a visual inspection check all nuts and bolts on wheel check tire thread and pressure do not use a trailer that is visually unsafe

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% back up vehicle as close as possible to the ball mount center the coupler directly above the ball mount lift the trailer tongue and place the coupler directly on the ball mount if using a jack, make sure it is seated properly activate the locking mechanism & cotter pin
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% connect the electrical cables test the brake lights & turn signals
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% always attach the safety chains for safety cross the chains over the hitch chains should be out of the way of the road & other mechanisms
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% how to hook up a gooseneck trailer

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% pay attention to the way you load the trailer place heavier cargo ahead of the front axle if vehicle begins to sway, decelerate & pull over center cargo & adjust weight distribution
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% be extra careful when towing a trailer check rearview mirrors frequently stay alert to the movements of the vehicle
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% maximum speed is 55 mph
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% shift into low gear when traveling down long or steep grades take care not to ride brakes

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect the correct answer is 55 mph continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue test your knowledge what is the maximum speed to safely tow a trailer? 35 mph 35 mph 35 mph 35 mph 35 mph 35 mph 65 mph 65 mph 65 mph 65 mph 65 mph 65 mph 55 mph 55 mph 55 mph 55 mph 55 mph 55 mph it depends on the size of the trailer it depends on the size of the trailer it depends on the size of the trailer it depends on the size of the trailer it depends on the size of the trailer it depends on the size of the trailer click the submit button
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% campus policies university trailers shall be operated by university personnel only, and trailers must be pulled by university vehicles.

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% campus policies departments are responsible for assuring that trailers in their care and custody conform to appropriate state and federal requirements and that individuals operating them are properly trained and licensed.

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% campus policies all university-owned trailers operated or towed on public or university roadways must be registered by fleet services in the name of the university of california and licensed as exempt vehicles.

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% campus policies all university trailers must have an annual safety inspection and any safety concerns repaired. if the inspection is not performed by fleet services, copies of the inspection must be sent to fleet for record keeping.

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% checklist do not move trailer until coupler is secured & locked to hitch safety chains are secured to tow vehicle trailer jack(s) are fully retracted do not tow trailer on the road until tires & wheels are checked trailer lights are connected & checked breakaway switch is connected to tow vehicle load is secure to trailer trailer brakes are checked click here to download

facilities.ucdavis.edu/fleetservices facilities.ucdavis.edu/fleetservices contact us fleetservices@ucdavis.edu fleetservices@ucdavis.edu 530-752-1199 530-752-1199 fleet services %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
exit course exit course exit course restart course restart course restart course congratulations, youve completed this course. fleet services %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%

" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="And above all, DRIVE SAFELY!!!!
